title: Shared i18n demo
subtitle: A lightweight React i18next wrapper with cookie persistence.

overview.heading: Overview
overview.description: @asafarim/shared-i18n is a production-grade internationalization (i18n) package for React applications.

features.title: Key Features
items: TypeScript support with full type safety
Pre-configured with common and identity-portal namespaces

useCases.title: Perfect For
items: Enterprise platforms with user language preferences

getStarted.heading: Get Started
getStarted.intro: Learn how to integrate @asafarim/shared-i18n into your React application in minutes.

steps.title: 1. Install the Package
steps.description: Add the package to your project dependencies.

steps.title: 2. Initialize i18n in Your App
steps.description: Call initI18n at application startup to configure language settings.

steps.title: 3. Use the useLanguage Hook
steps.description: Access language switching and current language state in your components.
steps.code:
const { changeLanguage, isChanging } = useLanguage();

<button onClick={() => changeLanguage('nl')}>
  Switch to Dutch
</button>

steps.title: 4. Translate with useTranslation
steps.description: Use the useTranslation hook to access translated strings.

steps.title: 5. Leverage Cookie Persistence
steps.description: User language preferences are automatically saved and restored.
steps.code:
// Automatically persisted via cookies
// No additional setup required!

steps.title: 6. Sync with Backend (Optional)
steps.description: Update user language preferences on your backend.

tips.title: Pro Tips
items: Use namespaces to organize translations by feature
Leverage the Trans component for complex translations with variables
Check browser language detection with getInitialLanguage()
Combine with design tokens for consistent theming across languages
